subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Crowdfunding Social Good
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Crowdfunding Social Good.

hook.text: Before crowdfunding, social entrepreneurs begged banks and foundations. Now they can pitch the entire internet.

buildup.text: Platforms like Kickstarter and Indiegogo let anyone raise money from thousands of small supporters.

discovery.text: Solar Sister used crowdfunding to train women in Africa to sell affordable solar lamps door to door.

twist.text: The hidden power isn't just moneyâ€”crowdfunding builds an army of advocates who spread the mission.

climax.text: Social enterprises have raised hundreds of millions through crowdfunding, bypassing gatekeepers entirely.

punchline.text: When the crowd believes in your mission, the money follows.

quiz.question: What is a unique advantage of crowdfunding for social enterprises beyond raising money?
options: It guarantees government tax breaks for every dollar raised
It builds a community of advocates who help spread the mission
It eliminates the need for a business plan or strategy
